If the cilia are paralyzed or destroyed by chemicals in cigarettes the body must to remove mucus from the lungs. If mucus is not removed from the lungs, microorganisms can grow in it and lead to .

response.name: mucus
response.feedback: Correct. The function of the cilia is to create an escalator that moves mucus from the lungs up into the trachea.

response.name: air
response.feedback: Incorrect. Air moves in and out of the lungs because of the differences in pressures between inside of the lungs and outside the lungs.

response.name: cough
response.feedback: Correct. If the cilia are paralyzed or destroyed the body still needs to remove the mucus from the lungs. The reflex of coughing will provide the physical force to remove the mucus.

response.name: sneeze
response.feedback: Incorrect. A sneeze is usually caused by an irritation of the nasal mucosa and is not used as a mechanism to remove mucus from deep in the lungs.

response.name: copd
response.feedback: Incorrect. COPD, is Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease is a broad category for diseases such as emphysema, and chronic bronchitis. These disease are characterized by obstruction of the airways and limitation to airflow.

response.name: pneumonia
response.feedback: Correct. The accumulation of mucus in the lungs can lead increased microbial growth. If the mucus cannot be moved out of the lungs then the bacteria can grow and cause disease such as pneumonia.
